data.commentary:
Right, with the formalities done with, Jason Roy and Sam Billings are out in their gear under the sun. Bhuvneshwar Kumar takes the new ball. He'll like these conditions. So too the slight of two slips to aim at

1.25pm The teams line up for the national anthems, walking out as Sunil Gavaskar rings the bell at the ground and a giant one it is too.

"Being part of KKR in the past, Morgan should know this pitch and ts behaviour pretty well. He may also know that Bhuvi can get good purchase on this pitch. Let us see what he & his boys do, this afternoon." True, Jose... P, but from memory, the Knight Riders hardly played on a pitch that even remotely had any grass on it considering the strength of their spinners.

For more Eden nostalgia, it's 30 years since Australia became world champions for the first time. The 1987 team was commemorated a world away in Sydney but it was here that their legend was born. Daniel Brettig , with help from Tom Moody.

"Solving a 4th order nonlinear differential equation is easier than figuring out what comment you will publish!!! Can a man get a break?!" There you go, Satya Narimetla. No go back to your scary math.

1.10 pm Considering India are bowling, it appears a good time to tune in to ahead of the game, when he said India have planned for this series with 350 as the par score. From the opposite came, here is Jason Roy, who has by getting set and then getting out but is excited to see Sam Billings - - back in the XI.

Soham Basak: "The 2 injuries for England could arguably make their batting stronger. Talk about batting strength!" A couple of milestones for England. This is Eoin Morgan's 150th ODI, while Ben Stokes is playing his 50th, where his spirit was broken, by Andrew Miller if anyone cares for a refresher.

Rameshwar: "Why only Dhavan got axed today. Similar treatment should be with Rahul also. He also did not perform in last 2 ODIs."

Sujaishil: "Really Rameshwar? Dhawan has got plenty of chances already. Rahul is just in his initial phase of limited overs career. And Rahane should have been in 11 in first place never understood his omission" .

Om Pashupati: "Awaiting the start of India last ODI here in Sweden. Cricket is generally not a very popular sport here But, my regular glueing to cricnfo during this series has generated quite a few interest towrds the game among my swedish friends here !"

1.00 pm India have won the toss and will bowl "Pretty decent surface," says Virat Kohli. "Won't change too much. It's always been a good chasing ground, quick outfield, ball travels in the air quickly and the dew as well. There's nothing like keeping winning games. Its important to create good habits and sustain them. It's about being ruthless. There has been dew, not too early in the evening, but dew is a massive factor in the last 15 overs. That means you can get settled. Just one change, Rahane in for Dhawan. It doesn't seem like India's change has come out of injury.

"Most grass I've seen on a Kolkata wicket," says Eoin Morgan, "We've been very competitive, lot of strong points from the two games before. Our batters have performed really well but our bowlers haven't quite hit their straps. Haven't played a complete game yet. Scoring 350 as a side in the first two games puts the batsmen in a good space. Two changes. Two injuries. Root has a niggle along with Hales' fractured hand. Sam Billings and Jonny Bairstow come in"

Vinod Rajpal: "England have lost all the 3 ODIs they have played at Eden Gardens , twice with India in 2007 & 2011, once with Aus in World Cup Final 1987"

anees zed: "" ...It's always been a good chasing ground..." always? Not quite sure when I think about India chasing a modest total in that (in)famous 96 WC SF against SL."

12.55 pm "There's a fair sprinkling of grass," says Sunil Gavaskar about the pitch in Kolkata. Now with the sun around, it might not come into play, but in the evening, the seam bowlers might have a bit of fun. You probably have to weigh that in with the dew factor, which is settling in around 5.30 - 6.00 pm. India's final ODI before the Champions Trophy in June is coming up.

RAV-QAT: "What is changed in cricket, I see so many scores of 300+ since last world cup? I thought the use 2 new ball will help the bowlers but they are battered often." But as it turns out, it has only helped the batsmen because they can count on the hardness staying on for longer. And on a flat pitch, even with fielders on the boundary, even with five of them there in the last 10 overs, batsmen can easily rack it up. In fact, England's 366 in the last game in Cuttack became the . ESPNcricinfo's stats editor S Rajesh looks at that and more.

12.50 pm The toss at Eden Gardens is coming up in 10 minutes. But elsewhere, the Australian Open continues in Melbourne, with Roger Federer, Andy Murray, Angelique Kerber, Stan Wawrinka and many more in action on Day 7. You can watch it all .

Anurag: "Andy Murray out of Aus Open. Only Federer and Wawrinka left as obstacles for Nadal. #hopes"

"Awaiting the start of 3rd ODI. 2:12 AM here in Boston but the match is worth the wait!" yelps Sanket Kumar, "Should India try Rahane today instead of Dhawan/Rahul?" I have no idea whatsoever but Vishal chimes in with this: "Dhawan was the first to hit the nets from India, so looks like he will keep his place. Bowlers also warming up at the square - Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar, Ashwin and Jadeja. And Woakes and Willey on the other side."

Harsh: "That will give me nightmares for days to come. I hope the epidemic does not spread to Kolkata."

12.45 pm Vishal Dikshit is enjoying life in Kolkata. And more importantly he has good news for those who prefer a slightly more even contest between bat and ball. "Beautiful day here - bright and sunny right now, gets breezy in the evening, making it a perfect Sunday for the locals. The ground is only starting to fill up. The quick bowlers will be hoping for a better day; the pitch could assist seamers early on, the ground is big (although with a quick outfield) and they'll hope the pitch is not as flat as the others."

Initial reading of how the teams may stack up. "Looks like England will make more changes than India today," says Vishal, "Billings is taking throw downs to take Hales' place [fractured hand], Jonny Bairstow was padded up early and had a look at the pitch, Liam Dawson was hanging around too. "

12.35 pm Runs, runs and more runs. There's been two matches, they've yielded a grand sum of 1453 and while the bowlers cringe and hide, is waving a bright, flashy chequered flag for both teams and, of course, Eden Gardens. This series is only 439 runs away from becoming the most productive one of three matches or less in the history of ODI cricket.

Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's live coverage of the third ODI between India and England. The hosts have won the series, and despite the margins being slim on the face of it, they have been emphatic victories indeed. Eoin Morgan though has said his men haven't quite put their best foot forward yet. . The toss is coming up at 1 pm, 25 minutes from now.

0.1

Kumar to Roy, no run, 127 kph, back of a length and outside off stump. No love from Roy

0.2

Kumar to Roy, no run, good length ball, aimed wider outside off stump, Roy ignores it again.

0.3

Kumar to Roy, no run, spots the inswinger and blocks with the full face of the bat. The 131 kph delivery begins moving in the air, then goes off the pitch too. Bhuvneshwar can extract a lot from a grassy pitch

0.4

Kumar to Roy, no run, extra bounce! Hits the deck properly this time, just outside off stump. It seems like a good ball to force through the covers off the back foot, but the kick does Roy. Lucky not to edge it

Some changes to the field. A third slip being added, and a man from the on side comes to cover. Midwicket open. Square leg open. It's a 7-2 off side field

0.5

Kumar to Roy, 1 wide, too far outside off stump for the batsman to have any say in matters, though Roy does try, going for a half-hearted, lead-footed cut

0.5

Kumar to Roy, no run, that's lovely. He pitches it up on and around off stump, doesn't quite get the amount of swing he would like, and Roy drives carefully to mid-off

0.6

Kumar to Roy, no run, top stuff to end the over. He pitches it on fourth stump, gets it to straighten off the deck and Roy, who is pushing hard while camped on the back foot, is beaten on the outside edge

Prajyot_pk: "@Satya..You can convert the 4th order Non Linear Differential Equation to ODE and then Runge Kutta is pretty easy for it...isn't it??" Flew right over my head

End of over 1 (1 run) England 1/0 (RR: 1.00)

    • JJ Roy 0 (6b)
    • SW Billings 0 (0b)
    • B Kumar 1-0-1-0

Hardik Pandya with the other new ball, perhaps because of the help in the pitch for seam and swing bowlers. Bumrah held back for the middle overs.

1.1

Pandya to Billings, no run, fuller delivery outside off, Billings begins as openers should. Not playing when he doesn't need to

Two slips, short point in

1.2

Pandya to Billings, no run, shortish and outside off, Billings moves back and across and avoids it

1.3

Pandya to Billings, no run, good shape away from the bat and Billings, who steps forward, in accordance to the fuller length, lets it go through to the wicketkeeper. Pitched on fifth stump and snaked towards slip

1.4

Pandya to Billings, no run, flirts at a fuller delivery outside off and is lucky not to nick off. Half a stride forward, all hands as he looks to drive through mid-off's left. Outswing does him

Short point has been done away with. Three slips for Pandya

1.5

Pandya to Billings, no run, good move from Billings. Shows you how he thinks as a batsman. Sees the swing on offer and combats it by walking down the pitch. Then realising the line was wide of off stump and still moving away, he leaves the dangerous delivery

1.6

Pandya to Billings, no run, back of a length and outside off, carry on, says Billings again. Seems like the openers have to pay their dues to cash in today

"This is big match for Hardik Pandya. To certain his position, he needs to divert his efforts to work on bowling skills. Rather than his batting ability, the team is looking for a quality Bowling All-rounder from him in order to provide more stability to this consistently improving side." Perhaps, Riaz Moh'd, but India wouldn't want him to ignore his batting. Such a clean striker

End of over 2 (maiden) England 1/0 (RR: 0.50)

    • SW Billings 0 (6b)
    • JJ Roy 0 (6b)
    • HH Pandya 1-1-0-0
    • B Kumar 1-0-1-0
2.1

Kumar to Roy, FOUR, lovely batting. First Roy is outside his crease to negate the swing. Then he comes out towards the off side to exploit the thin legside field. There's only two there. And he flicks it over the vacant midwicket

2.2

Kumar to Roy, 1 run, steers a good length ball towards third man to get off strike

2.3

Kumar to Billings, no run, walks at the bowler again, so Bhuvneshwar floats a fuller ball away from his reach, toeing the wide line with his away swing. Beaten on the drive by the outswing

2.4

Kumar to Billings, no run, good length ball outside off, allowed through to the keeper

2.5

Kumar to Billings, no run, fuller delivery, coming in through the air, Billings spots it and blocks with soft hands

2.6

Kumar to Billings, no run, spears a full and wide delivery to point by not necessarily moving his front leg, but bending his back leg to get into position. Has good still head and doesn't overhit the ball

End of over 3 (5 runs) England 6/0 (RR: 2.00)

    • SW Billings 0 (10b)
    • JJ Roy 5 (8b 1x4)
    • B Kumar 2-0-6-0
    • HH Pandya 1-1-0-0
3.1

Pandya to Roy, no run, thought about reaching for this back of a length delivery veering away off the deck. Pulls his bat back just in time. This isn't an unplayable pitch. Just need to wait. The batsman just need to be patient

3.2

Pandya to Roy, FOUR, strays a bit too straight, and with only two men on the leg side, Roy basically drives it wide of mid-on. On impact, the bat was very straight. Then comes a flick of the wrist during the followthrough

3.3

Pandya to Roy, 1 run, shortish on off stump, Roy hangs back and flicks it through to deep square leg

Sham: "Different surface, different ODI today. In India can you get such a range of pitches - top stuf!! "

3.4

Pandya to Billings, FOUR, superb shot through extra cover. The man at mid-off could maybe have put in a better effort, was it Rahane? It's a fuller delivery just outside off stump and Billings takes a strong stride forward and hits with the swing.

3.5

Pandya to Billings, no run, beaten on the drive this time. Good on Pandya to keep pitching the ball up. He can swing it away. He has three slips encouraging him to do so.

3.6

Pandya to Billings, FOUR, a touch too straight again and Billings comes forward, takes a straight ball on middle and off stump and whips it through vacant midwicket. Pandya wears a grimace. Not sure he has the control to bowl to a 7-2 off side field

End of over 4 (13 runs) England 19/0 (RR: 4.75)

    • SW Billings 8 (13b 2x4)
    • JJ Roy 10 (11b 2x4)
    • HH Pandya 2-1-13-0
    • B Kumar 2-0-6-0
4.1

Kumar to Roy, no run, beats him with a shortish delivery pitching just outside off stump. Roy is trying to defend, but the ball moves away and gets big on him

4.2

Kumar to Roy, FOUR, short and wide, and it doesn't matter how many people are there, Roy's power can deal with them. Carves it over point. That's a pretty terrible ball on this pitch

Two slips, and a midwicket in now

4.3

Kumar to Roy, no run, good length ball on middle, Roy is squared up as he defends. He's worried about the ball straightening off the pitch, and it does. Just enough

4.4

Kumar to Roy, FOUR, on the pads and Roy clips it between mid-on and midwicket. Excellent timing. Is the swing fading already? Or is this a one-off? Because Bhuvneshwar's seam position is towards slip, as he pitches on middle stump, looking for the magic delivery

4.5

Kumar to Roy, no run, shortish on middle, nudged to midwicket

4.6

Kumar to Roy, no run, fuller on off stump, pushes to mid-off.

"*reads Sham's comment**gets popcorn**waiting for comments on subcontinent pitches and India being strong at home comments in reply to Sham's comment*" So people, what do you have for me and Jiten Surtani?

End of over 5 (8 runs) England 27/0 (RR: 5.40)

    • JJ Roy 18 (17b 4x4)
    • SW Billings 8 (13b 2x4)
    • B Kumar 3-0-14-0
    • HH Pandya 2-1-13-0

Prajyot_pk: "What Pandya need to learn is the variation and length that he needs to bowl...he is too short for his pace and as we have seen even in WT20 he can be tonked anywhere in the park due to it..so better coaching staff need to tell him he has be Pollockesque...not Shaun Tait!!" That's some big shoes to fill. Polly's South Africa's highest Test wicket-taker!

5.1

Pandya to Billings, no run, short of a length and outside off, Billings shoulders arms

Two slips, mid-on and midwicket on the leg side

5.2

Pandya to Billings, no run, lovely bowling. This is at 137 kph, just outside off. Billings is pinned to the crease, not knowing which way to move because the fullish length is tying him down. Then the seam movement off the pitch defeats him

5.3

Pandya to Billings, 1 run, angles the ball into middle and leg, Billings is cramped up, but he is still able to flick the ball to the left of deep backward square leg

Only one slip for Pandya now. Kohli and Dhoni paling it up there. There's a gully though

5.4

Pandya to Roy, no run, takes a length ball on the up and drives to cover. Makes contact off the bottom of the bat.

5.5

Pandya to Roy, no run, excellent length. It's full, it's asking for the drive, and there is just enough movement in the air and off the pitch to beat Roy's nervy cover drive

5.6

Pandya to Roy, FOUR, stands and delivers, crunches this off drive past mid-off's right. Skillful cricket from Roy. Again, all he did was step forward to a fuller delivery and present the full face.

End of over 6 (5 runs) England 32/0 (RR: 5.33)

    • JJ Roy 22 (20b 5x4)
    • SW Billings 9 (16b 2x4)
    • HH Pandya 3-1-18-0
    • B Kumar 3-0-14-0

The batsman has been beaten every over with the swing and seam on offer, but Billings and Roy have put away the boundary balls repeatedly and that's why England are 32 for 0 in six overs

6.1

Kumar to Billings, no run, shortish and outside off, Billings sets up for the cut, but this time the ball misbehaves by staying low

6.2

Kumar to Billings, no run, back of a length, on fifth stump, coming in towards the off stump. Billings moves across to protect it and then leaves. Dhoni takes that at chest high this time. Spungy bounce

6.3

Kumar to Billings, no run, back of a length and outside off, Billings pushes at the ball, with only his hands, and he is beaten by the seam movement away. England hanging on in tough conditions

6.4

Kumar to Billings, no run, walks across and at the bowler so the good length ball outside off is slid to point

6.5

Kumar to Billings, 1 run, goes wide of the crease to see if the ball can straighten down the line. It does, but with the length short, the batsman, though it seems like he has edged it, is still in control of it. Single to third man

6.6

Kumar to Roy, no run, this shortish delivery comes in off the pitch and Roy, aiming to cut, adjusts his shot just in time. And because he softens his hands, the inside edge doesn't go anywhere close to his stumps

Prateek: "11 scoring shots out of 6 overs with 7 boundaries. That's really good opening bowling, which doesn't get enough credit. More dot balls upfront." You'd still prefer lesser balls going for boundaries though, and some of them were the result of them not bowling to their field.

End of over 7 (1 run) England 33/0 (RR: 4.71)

    • JJ Roy 22 (21b 5x4)
    • SW Billings 10 (21b 2x4)
    • B Kumar 4-0-15-0
    • HH Pandya 3-1-18-0

Jasprit Bumrah replaces Hardik Pandya

7.1

Bumrah to Billings, no run, there's another that flies past the edge. Billings wafts at a length ball, aiming to flat bat it through cover.

7.2

Bumrah to Billings, no run, back of a length and outside off, Billings tries to cut, but he seems to play under the ball and is beaten again

7.3

Bumrah to Billings, no run, on the up drive, no connection again. Third consecutive play and miss. Good length from Bumrah. It's not his usual yorkers. it's not the short ball either. Just a good length on and around the off stump

7.4

Bumrah to Billings, no run, edged, but Billings hasn't pushed hard at this ball. It falls short of Rahul at second slip. Good length, and just outside off stump

7.5

Bumrah to Billings, no run, walks at the bowler and a length ball well wide of off stump allows him to free the arms. Slashed to point

7.6

Bumrah to Billings, no run, extra bounce this time. Whoa. Seems like the honeymoon's over, boys. Time to face real life. And it is holding grudges. This good length ball outside off just kicks up off the deck like a cobra. Beats the front-foot slap

End of over 8 (maiden) England 33/0 (RR: 4.12)

    • SW Billings 10 (27b 2x4)
    • JJ Roy 22 (21b 5x4)
    • JJ Bumrah 1-1-0-0
    • B Kumar 4-0-15-0
8.1

Kumar to Roy, no run, shortish and aims it at the body, Roy keeps it out

8.2

Kumar to Roy, no run, just a little room and Roy sets up with a cut. Doesn't quite pick the gap at point though

samraat maharja: "Unlucky is right word to sums up indian bowling so far." Skillful as well. Disciplined, for the most part.

8.3

Kumar to Roy, no run, lets this come on and glides the shortish delivery towards backward point

Wilson: "31 dot balls in the first 7 overs and the runrate still about 5 per over. Speaks a lot about th pitch... Having said that, England needs to minimize the number of dotballs..." They're looking for boundaries a bit too often, methinks. Not that it's easy to manoeuvre when the new ball is moving as much as it is right now

8.4

Kumar to Roy, no run, shortish and outside off, cut to point

8.5

Kumar to Roy, FOUR, just beats Rahane running back and to his left from mid-off. Roy wants release. He looks for it by haring down the track. Gets under a length ball on off stump and having made room for himself he is able to slash it away. No control. Just enough power

8.6

Kumar to Roy, 2 runs, lovely hit through straight midwicket. Roy walks at the bowler, he judges this to be the one that moves away, so he moves across to get in line with it and then works his wrists to find the gap past mid-on's right

End of over 9 (6 runs) England 39/0 (RR: 4.33)

    • JJ Roy 28 (27b 6x4)
    • SW Billings 10 (27b 2x4)
    • B Kumar 5-0-21-0
    • JJ Bumrah 1-1-0-0
9.1

Bumrah to Billings, no run, continues to have the batsman in a tangle. His action is generating a lot more bounce than his team-mates. So he tries digging in a short ball, aims it at Billings' head, cramping him. The batsman goes for a hook and is beaten for pace

9.2

Bumrah to Billings, FOUR, hammered through extra cover. His spell of seven dots is broken as Bumrah gives room to the batsman. Flays the bat through the line of a fuller ball and picks the gap to the left of mid-off

9.3

Bumrah to Billings, no run, cuts him in half. This is the indipper. Comes in off the pitch, and there is so much movement too. Billings seems to be accounting for the ball's change in direction but it just does so much

9.4

Bumrah to Billings, no run, moves forward and across and flicks a length ball towards midwicket

9.5

Bumrah to Billings, no run, blocks with an open face towards point

9.6

Bumrah to Billings, no run, unplayable. Downright trickery, really. Bumrah's action and his angle means the ball is always coming into the right-hander. Billings counts on that as he walks down the pitch, but the ball hits the deck, just short of a good length straightens past the defensive bat and goes through to the keeper.

End of over 10 (4 runs) England 43/0 (RR: 4.30)

    • SW Billings 14 (33b 3x4)
    • JJ Roy 28 (27b 6x4)
    • JJ Bumrah 2-1-4-0
    • B Kumar 5-0-21-0

"Ashwin went off the field after the 10th over, Pandey came on," says Vishal from the ground

10.1

Pandya to Roy, no run, keeps low having beaten the bat. This is on a good length, just outside off. Roy tries to defend but it moves off the seam

10.2

Pandya to Roy, 1 run, on the pads and Roy, playing as late as he can, flicks it to long leg. More of the inside edge, I suspect

10.3

Pandya to Billings, FOUR, driven back past the bowler. Shows there is value for runs here. Any time the batsman have even remotely timed the ball into a gap, it hurries away. This is a good length ball and Billings just hit through the line. The impact was more off the inside half of the bat

Kshitij: "This pitch would've provided the Indians the perfect match practice for the CT, only if the dates were closer..."

10.4

Pandya to Billings, no run, good length and outside off, pushes it into the covers

Akshay: "Trump era begins with a run rate of around 4.5 in first 10 overs. That's some impact! "

10.5

Pandya to Billings, 1 run, shortish and outside of, steers it to point and pinches a quick single. That's excellent work. They beat Jadeja's arm

10.6

Pandya to Roy, FOUR, that's the worst ball on this pitch. Short, afforing all the room the batsman needs to do his dirty business. And this is gloriously dirty. A pull, standing tall on the front foot to the left of midwicket

End of over 11 (10 runs) England 53/0 (RR: 4.81)

    • JJ Roy 33 (30b 7x4)
    • SW Billings 19 (36b 4x4)
    • HH Pandya 4-1-28-0
    • JJ Bumrah 2-1-4-0

Akshay: "Eyes have been dying to see this stuff. No matter the what the outcome, but this is what cricket is about. Hats off to the CAB, and the curator. What we have seen in the past two games is just an obscene rip-off of cricket."

Chetan: "Important game for Bumrah in my opinion. Hasn't had a good game in the series. No one has but Bumrah has been very inconsistent- a lot of beamers and hot hitting the Yorker."

11.1

Bumrah to Billings, 1 run, good length ball at off stump, Billings defends with an open face through the covers

11.2

Bumrah to Roy, no run, drives a length ball on off stump to mid-off with a wristy flourish. It's a difficult shot to pull off when there's sideways movement on offer, but Roy is succeeding by connecting with a straight bat and then doing the extra bit

11.3

Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, back of a length and outside off, steers it to deep third man

Vishal pings in again: Ashwin back on the field, nothing to worry about for the Indian team

11.4

Bumrah to Billings, no run, defends a back of a length ball on off stump into the covers

11.5

Bumrah to Billings, 1 run, angled into the middle and leg stump and Billings flicks it through to deep midwicket

Mayuresh : "Last time England whitewashed in an ODI series was against India in India when they lost 5-0 in 2011!!!"

11.6

Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, moves across outside off to pull a short delivery to the right of mid-on. Mistimes it. It's almost as it the ball didn't come on the way he expected. What the heck's going on, Kolkata? Where have you been? The game's on.

End of over 12 (4 runs) England 57/0 (RR: 4.75)

    • JJ Roy 35 (33b 7x4)
    • SW Billings 21 (39b 4x4)
    • JJ Bumrah 3-1-8-0
    • HH Pandya 4-1-28-0

Spin in the 13th over, with Yuvraj Singh ahead of R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja

12.1

Yuvraj Singh to Roy, 1 run, short and wide outside off, cut to deep point

12.2

Yuvraj Singh to Billings, 1 run, pushes it through on leg stump, flicks it through midwicket

12.3

Yuvraj Singh to Roy, 1 run, stands up tall against a short delivery outside off and pats it to long-on

12.4

Yuvraj Singh to Billings, no run, steps down the track, trying to play for turn, but it just comes on with the angle. Billings just about manages to flick it behind square leg. They think about a single, but Roy says no just in time to send his partner back before the throw

12.5

Yuvraj Singh to Billings, no run, cramps him for room and he blocks down the pitch

12.6

Yuvraj Singh to Billings, 2 runs, good footwork, this is just a bit short and just a bit wide. Billings jumps back in his crease and carves the ball behind point, meaning the man in the deep has to run a distance to his left

End of over 13 (5 runs) England 62/0 (RR: 4.76)

    • SW Billings 24 (43b 4x4)
    • JJ Roy 37 (35b 7x4)
    • Yuvraj Singh 1-0-5-0
    • JJ Bumrah 3-1-8-0

Saumil: "Hey Al, what seems to be par score on this gound in these conditions?" Might still be above 300, with dew expected later in the evening. But darn if it ain't good to see the ball having a ball

13.1

Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, forces the ball away to the right of mid-on. Roy has to get up on his toes to get on top of the bounce, and then his bottom-handed power comes through with the shot. Pandya moves quickly to his right and stops the pull shot from beating him

13.2

Bumrah to Billings, 1 bye, that's got too much heat for the batsman and Dhoni. Short and angled into middle and leg, cramping the batsman, the ball coming up to his chin. He goes for an instinctive hook and is beaten. Wicketkeeper moves to his left, but only parries the ball away. One bouncer for the over

13.3

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, inside edge as the ball coming back in has the batsman, whose backlift comes from gully, in trouble. he has quick hands and his ability to play with a straight bat masks this weakness. But an indipper, pitched a touch short outside off can get him chopping on

13.4

Bumrah to Roy, 2 runs, shortish and outside off, steers it off the open face to deep third man, where Bhuvneshwar puts in the dive to stop a boundary

13.5

Bumrah to Roy, 1 wide, umpire Chaudhary calls it a wide as Bumrah digs this short ball into the deck and it soars over the batsman's head

13.5

Bumrah to Roy, 1 leg bye, hits him in the gut. This is a back of a length delivery, moving in at the batsman and rising more than he expects

5.10 pm England got 58 from their last five with Ben Stokes and Chris Woakes making sure the top-order's work against a new ball that swung and seamed rather remarkably for Indian conditions did not go to waste. Still Jason Roy wouldn't be happy to have given his wicket away in the 60s. Sam Billings and Eoin Morgan picked out the only fielder in the region to pop a catch to. But offsetting all that was Jonny Bairstow, playing his first game of the series, hitting a fifty and helping the lower-middle order push on to get 321, which is a good total on this deck.

Vishal says, "a mini presentation happening at the ground - Dhoni being felicitated and presented with a memento by Kapil Dev, on behalf of Cricket Association of Bengal, for his contribution as India captain. They have also named four stands after some of the biggest names from Bengal in cricket - Pankaj Roy, BN Dutt, Jagmohan Dalmiya and Sourav Ganguly"

"The way I started with a couple of boundaries, but I came back well. The pitch was doing something. We bowled pretty well at the start, but they were scoring boundaries as well. It'll be a good contest with the new ball moving around," says Hardik Pandya. "We'll have to wait till the ball stops swinging. When I got the shoulder injury, I was worried, but I did my training and I'm happy to be back. The dew will come, even in the last few overs we asked the curators about it and they said it will come"
